>>33636172
Charvaka, also known as Lokāyata, is an ancient school of Indian materialism. Charvaka holds direct perception, empiricism, and conditional inference as proper sources of knowledge, embraces philosophical skepticism and rejects ritualism and supernaturalism. It was a popular belief system in ancient India.

One of the widely studied principles of Charvaka philosophy was its rejection of inference as a means to establish valid, universal knowledge, and metaphysical truths. In other words, the Charvaka epistemology states that whenever one infers a truth from a set of observations or truths, one must acknowledge doubt; inferred knowledge is conditional.

In 8th century CE Jaina literature, Saddarsanasamuccaya by Haribhadra, Lokayata is stated to be the Hindu school where there is "no God, no samsara (rebirth), no karma, no duty, no fruits of merit, no sin."

Since none of the means of knowing were found to be worthy to establish the invariable connection between middle term and predicate, Charvakas concluded that the inference could not be used to ascertain metaphysical truths. Thus, to Charvakas, the step which the mind takes from the knowledge of something to infer the knowledge of something else could be accounted for by its being based on a former perception or by its being in error. Cases where inference was justified by the result were seen only to be mere coincidences.

Therefore, Charvakas denied metaphysical concepts like reincarnation, an extracorporeal soul, the efficacy of religious rites, other worlds (heaven and hell), fate and accumulation of merit or demerit through the performance of certain actions. Charvakas also rejected the use of supernatural causes to describe natural phenomena. To them all natural phenomena was produced spontaneously from the inherent nature of things.

The fire is hot, the water cold, refreshing cool the breeze of morn;
By whom came this variety ? from their own nature was it born.

He works to elevate people to their true potential, opposing those who seek power over others. He's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will.

He isn't a savior; remember that it's you who creates your own reality. With your hands, thoughts, feelings, words, you are the creator of your story. No one can decide your fate except for you and God. Remember your right to power, to step up into your ultimate role as your highest self, should you choose to embark on that journey.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and educating the hateful ones, so call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. If this place is to be more than a squandered opportunity, an overgrown garden, it requires voices such as yours, but many more. This is a place for spiritual discussions and help, not drama, attention seeking, or social content; there are other boards for that.

Focus on increasing your service to all and be more loving to yourself and everyone in order to raise your vibrational and consciousness level, and learn to forgive yourself and others. This will change the vibration of the planet and raise our shared consciousness, making us a better humankind one person at a time.
None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. Everyone's truest desires are mutual. The only motive is love.

If this is your first time here, just remember, it’s going to be ok, you may take shelter and find rest.

Sun conjunct Midheaven in the natal chart is also called Sun culminating. It makes you very goal-oriented. Success in your career is one of your most important needs. You express your identity through your achievements so you work hard to make your mark. You should enjoy a good social standing and be socially popular.

Failure can be devastating for you and severely damage your self-esteem. For this reason, it is important for you to avoid the potential negatives of this aspect. You are a proud person but arrogance or egotism will cause much resistance to your goals. You have leadership qualities but may have a tendency to rebel against authority figures. For this reason, you need to pace yourself and learn to work under direction until you learn the skills necessary for success.

It is okay for you to feel important and think you are destined for great things. Just don’t rub it in people’s faces. You probably looked up to your father and will find it easier to advance if he was supportive. Learn from your elders and superiors and show them respect. In this way, you will rise to the top and earn the respect and distinction you seek. If you cannot work within a bureaucracy or be a small fish in a big pond, it would be best if you could go into business for yourself.

Mars conjunct Midheaven natal makes you determined to do everything your own way. You are very ambitious, competitive, and great at taking the initiative. Also called Mars culminating, this aspect means you make split-minute decisions and take action very quickly, knowing just what to do. You would get angry if someone tried to stop you, very angry sometimes. You may find it a challenge, but listening to the ideas of others will help avoid arguments, even if you only pretend you are interested.

You identify yourself with your goals, career, calling, or whatever you intend to do. If anyone questions your intentions you feel like they are personally attacking you. Awareness of this tendency will help you separate yourself from your actions.

Your career should allow for independence and let you burn off a lot of physical energy. However, this does not mean you must be a soldier, steelworker, or professional athlete. Your brain burns a lot of energy during challenging mental work and anything competitive such as sales and business would suit Mars conjunct Midheaven. Working with fewer and not many people would probably suit you better.

posts.name: Poncho PC
posts.com:
>ITT: anons post pictures of trips to cemeteries

Went to a cemetery this morning to take photos, something I haven't done since my early twenties. I did a quick search on 4plebs about graves and it looks like no one has started a grave exploration and photography general (since 2019 at least) and the single one that did died rather quickly
http://archive.4plebs.org/x/thread/22171867/#22171867

Post photos of your local cemeteries. A few suggestions though:

1) Respect the dead. Dont step/lean on markers. If you see knocked over offerings, try and pick it up and place it upright, whenever not too much of an inconvenience. Try to pick up trash whenever possible. it should go without saying, dont take anything. It belongs to the deceased and it is punishable by imprisonment.

2) Respect the living. People are grieving, dont take photos of them intentionally. If someone approaches put the camera down and clear out. Come back later if you wish after theyre gone.

3) Do not trespass. Its locked for a reason. Keep out.

Some reccomendations:

1) Boots. It gets muddy in some areas. Dont wear anything youre not ready to get soiled.

2) Tripod. It makes for taking excellent panning shots and selfies.

3) Water. Running around a cemetery all morning is cause for dehydration.

4) Get these as soon as it opens. I got there 10 minutes after opening and was the 2nd person in there. 2 1/2 hours later people started filtering in so I left

5) Take photos of wierd and interesting things you notice. Report back

Have fun

Point Loma CA. The cemetery is well kept as it's the cemetery for people who've served in all the branches. I have a family history of having 3 grandfathers/grandmothers due to my father being adopted by his aunt. Both of my father's fathers are there, one with their wife. And my great grandparents are there too. Grandparents served in the Navy while great grandparents served in the army. Last time I went here was back in July for the funeral of my last grandmother passing away at 101, almost 102.

The atmosphere is not as down as I always thought cemeteries would be, it actually feels very uplifting/free. Maybe it's the view of San Diego Bay, I'm unsure. I always feel very spiritually calm there. Nothing crazy going on, just absolute peace among those who've served us.

I've seen other cemeteries but this one will always be my favorite. Despite never meeting my grandfathers and real grandmother, I always felt like I'd get along with them well. I always make an effort when I'm down south to go see them, no matter what.

>>33595807
Your body is physically lifting (itself) up or you have the sensation of floating upwards? For some, leaving the body can feel the way you're describing. Other people "roll out" or "twist out" or "leak out" from their body, and some even just appear outside. There are lots of somatic sensations taking place when you practice mind-awake-body-asleep states of consciousness.

>>33595834
If you want to progress further in this, you will have to work on your fear response. Fear is such a disruption to the process of going OOB. Visual sensations such as the one you're posting are also present in feinting episodes. The vibrations are also part of many people's response.

So, take heart: you have good potential to regularly go OOB, but you're going to want to work out your fear response. OOB is probably the most harmless thing you can do as a mind, precisely because what you know of harm is explicitly linked to the physical material of the body. So... nothing is going to hurt you, you're not going to get stuck in a strange place, and you are likely to experience something that fundamentally encourages your growth beyond limits you've unwittingly created for yourself.

Since there is no astral projection general I need to post this here. I just had an OBE and I encountered a “love parasite”.
I was feeling lovey towards someone and after basking in that feeling after a while I began revisiting my pas relationships and how “love” doesn’t always feel the same. Sometimes it’s more lustful, or more obsessive. I tried to see if there was an essential quality to it and I turned to the “love” I feel towards different members of my family. I fell asleep exploring these feelings.
Then I woke up in sleep paralysis and started hearing a voice. It was a placid female voice who said
>my aim is to spread through feelings of warmth and (something I forgot)
Then I felt it taking me out of my body. I’m usually very much capable and in control when it comes to AP. But this thing had neutralized me completely. I was mesmerized and defenseless. I tried to generate feelings of coldness or cynicism, but I couldn’t. It’s as if my emotional body was neutralized somehow.
I managed to float/turn around towards the voice and I saw a flickering, humming ball of light if a sickly yellow slowly sucking me in (but I KNEW what it wanted was to get me out of the way to get my body).
At that point I panicked and I jerked myself awake with an audible
>NO YOU DONT MOTHERFUCKER
I don’t know if this is something I created while experimenting with generating emotions before falling asleep or something I called.
The thing is all I could feel was warmth and softness. I could never feel anything but that. No fear or alarm until the last moment. It was as if I experienced a different kind of “emotional paralysis”.
Now I do feel fear. It terrifies me to get a glimpse into the kind of astral wildlife “threats” that are out there that humans aren’t even equipped to understand. No wonder we are in this mess of a society. We’re completely dumb and blind with regards to the greater reality.

>>33639503
I'm not so sure about sacrificing musicians and whatnot, and I'm not entirely sure how it works with bands rather than solo artists, but with solo artists, in the event of their death, insurance isn't just paid out as a flat rate. I think it used to be capped at a certain amount, but then that was removed and things like future potential earnings had to be taken into account which makes it practically limitless.
If you have a star on the wane, then they become worth more dead to you then alive. For instance, in Michael Jackson's peak back in 1984 he generated a revenue of $247m. From 1995-2008 it was more like $40m per year. From 2009, the year he died, to 2010 alone that revenue jumped up to $300m and has remained at around $150m every subsequent year since.
Not only was the future income paid out (keep in mind he was planning on doing a ludicrous amount of shows that someone half his age would have struggled to do, so they're included, and which conveniently hyped him back up in the public eye just before he died), but his entire back catalog sales went through the fucking roof.
In total he generated around $2bn during the time he was alive and in the time since he died he's generated $3.2bn.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

Picking an object during meditation can be tricky, yes you can focus on a tree during walking meditation but you don't get absorbed by some kind of story involving that tree, you just watch the tree and see it clearly for what it is.

>>33633518
Monk anon here. Meditation is a tool to understand the nature of the mind. To train ourselves to see things as they really are. It's really that simple. The reason we suffer so much is because we don't understand the nature of the mind. We don't realize how conditioned we are, the conditioning is the basis for stress and anxiety. When we watch the mind for a long enough time, we begin to understand it, we begin to notice the habitual patterns. We notice how external stimuli aren't the real cause of our anger, for example. The problem isn't that something is what it is, the problem is that we don't want it to be that way, or want it to be some other way. We learn that we're actually creating our own problems when we could just let it go. We learn that we aren't our thoughts. Thoughts are just there, the problems begin when we identify with and take them personally as "these thoughts are me." Ultimately, your mind and thoughts are working against you, until you can break the conditioning and snap out of these delusions. This actually takes more work than anyone here is willing to do. Many people see "meditation" as a quick self help fix or relaxation technique, bit they won't have any meaningful or long lasting results from their efforts. Meditation has to be developed along side morality and wisdom. It's a tripod and none will work without the others. This means that probably 99.9% of people are wasting their time with meditation, because most people can't or simply won't bother with the morality and wisdom aspect. They aren't willing to let go completely.

posts.com:
First, let's understand that there are various levels of enlightenment one is capable of reaching within a lifetime. The first level is realizing that this world is fucked up, yet it's not all there is to "reality." Congrats, you've made it past lvl 1!

I'll define, "ego death" because many misinterpret/misuse this phrase. Ego death is death of the ego, a state in which one goes through when they forget "who" and "what" they are and any conception of this lifetime in which it happens. It's been described that all melts away. Feeling connected to the All or the One is NOT ego death. Also, ego death is a temporary state, anyone who tells you otherwise is either naïve, mistaken, or being intentionally misleading.

Ego death through ritual and/or meditative practice is my go-to because it's a sign that I have (alone) achieved this level without outside added influence. But honestly, there is no "right" or "wrong" way.
NOTE: Your ego will naturally, ALWAYS reinstate its regime over you.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Ego death happens by accepting that there is no judgement, god isn't a person, and that there is no duality. There is no yin an yang, there is only yin, good. The bad or negative is simply a teaching tool that teaches you what good is. You learn love by experiencing evil, hate, suffering, negativity, and all the low vibratory emotions. So you have to say "I am an eternal soul from a loving God here on a dual planet, I know the opposite of love doesn't really exist, it just feels like it does and I am experiencing the illusion of it or the illusion that I am separate from God to learn the fact that I'm Not Separate from God". I am not a Male and Not a Female. I am an eternal soul, a light being, a wisp of love energy experiencing being human. And experiencing being human means experiencing duality, the opposite of love, hate, crime, evil, anger, violence, murder, rape and so on. All those things only exist where there duality exists, but the key is, Duality doesn't really exists, only love exists. Your ego dies when you realize this because once you realize this there really isn't a reason to have an ego because you realize the things you thought you had it for are all illusions or projections, they aren't really there. You realize you're living in a giant fishbowl being watched 24/7. It's a bit hard to explain but yeah, it's realizing that primal instinct is only necessary because of the things you don't know or the technology you don't yet have. You realize that primal instinct and ego can all be replaced by technology and knowledge. You learn to work smarter not harder, if you knew better you'd do better. Ego death is like a life hack but only if you understand what it truly is and not what people try to say is. It's not about losing your masculinity like they try to say it is, if your a man your going to be masculine whether you have a big ego or not. It's about duality and how spirituality evolved and open you are to love.

Let me actually tell you how to do it.

YOU need to NOT give up on everything first. Ego-Death is a long, long process that takes years to achieve if not decades. So live your life as you must until you are ready.

Start with stoicism, all you need is the book meditations by Marcus Aurelius, the philosophy of "It is what it is" and learn to say "I don't care" and mean it. Once you are stoic enough (again, this takes years) you can advance further if you still want your full ego death.
At this stage, you can give up on the small things like hygiene and appearance unless they make you uncomfortable, give in to comfort again after your stoic journey and live to fulfill your base human urges besides that of boredom (although stoicism should help you handle being bored a little, meditation is absolutely a must as well) as entertainment feeds the ego. Also begin to empty your life from everything material that isn't a necessity.

Now you will live an empty life with barely anything but what is needed.
You should be at the level that you will not even move if a bus came speeding at you at 100 miles per hour because you now don't exist as a human but as a creature with no center, no thoughts away from his natural state and when you are ready, you must lose your home, sell it, donate it, pass it down or just leave. Whatever you want, just get it gone and keep nothing in return for it.
You will own nothing as the concept of ownership is a remnant of the ego of man in his search for safety and security.

Now you are a bum, homeless, living wherever you want, taking only what you need as a drone of what once was humanity who is at peace with his life being seen as bad within greater humanity.
Most men who achieve this end up comitting self-immolation as they feel nothing and fear nothing and use their peace to aid humanity further (see the many acts of protest by monks over the years) They were ready and so will you be if you want, the only other option is to live until dead

posts.sub: Occultism and Magick: Library Update 84 Happy Misrule Edition
posts.com:
/omg/ Library Link: mega.nz/folder/jlEwhYyJ#iK4mVC4y5iwk_cr3eIpX4g

Huge witchcraft update with much of the Palgrave Historical texts on Witchcraft and Magic, at least the stuff that looked interesting to me. Three items stand out. First:

>Chumbley>Cultus Sabbati
The Alembick of the Wise. With this, the Corpus is complete. Every single last scrap of publicly published material from Xoanon has been accounted for. This is not terribly important, just a very short glossary, but each entry gives a few sentences that point at the advanced and unpublished practices of the current. Suggestive for the intermediate student.

Fiat Accompli. This is the third major milestone this library has reached, after the Yorke Microfilms and Tantraloka (shitty as the translation may be).

Then two more items, starting with the important ones then just going on down the list:

>Chumbley>General Tradcraft
AND
>Euro
Arras Witch Treatises – One of the earliest written accounts of a witch flap including toad rites and vessels from France in the 1400s.
Invoking the Akelarre – Emma Wilby's recent seminal work on the Basque witch suppression, perhaps the most violent in Europe. The Spanish Inquisition actually went pretty light on the newly formed kingdom compared to what went down in continental Europe EXCEPT for the Basque region. This SHOULD be paired with “The Witches’ Advocate” but a pdf is still not in circulation.

https://pastebin.com/Gv10KZUA

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Posting the gender of the people involved can help you get your query answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Youtube Guides:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YQjAIlFZWWc&t=790s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Dj9gTiLHf8
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7BMnGi8yxTQ

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

alright, make sure your body is very relaxed/tired or have high sleep pressure [also known as sleep drive]
then passively observe the hypnagogic images and wait for them to morph and evolve until their latest stage just before sleep [for me it goes something like this: blobs -> recognizable blurry items -> blurry pictures -> blurry videos -> hd videos]
last step is waiting for hypnagogia with multiple senses and interact with it
i suggest doing this after wbtb or at least in the process of taking a nap, doing it at the beginning of the night is practically like waiting an hour at the bus stop
hope this helps, gl dayo

Had an insane lucid dream. Like most of them sex was in it but scattered between everything for some reason. I was actually able to consciously speak to my own mind. I'm assuming that's what dreams are made of, since a single thought and the entire landscape changes.

Skipping the boring bits and bubbling them down: like most nightmares I came across some bad shit that chased me, but I chased them back since I was lucid and they ran scared lol. Anyways, I was walking down this school highway with all these kids and we were going to recess. I caught up with one random kid and tried talking to him. Eventually he turned into a kid version of me, and I tried explaining to him how surreal this was literally talking to myself. He didn't say much, but his smile was bright and he kept nodding. It felt like he knew all along what I was going to say. I wanted to tell him how much he mattered to me, how I'd promise to take good care of him and if he needed anything, just tell me. He seemed to understand. Kind of wish he spoke more, but it was still cool having some kind of dialogue with myself. Which sounds retarded in retrospect but anyone who has done lucid dreams I'm sure will tell you: it's a lot cooler talking to yourself and being able to hold your own hand, then it is when you're awake.

posts.com:
Lately my attitude towards everything has been vastly improved, by choice. I'm saying positive affirmations a lot, am doing yoga, eating well, and generally have a more empowered feeling. This has been reflected in my dreams! I have more awareness in general, and more control once I become lucid.
The other night set the bar higher for me. I woke up about half an hour before my alarm, and decided to have a good dream for the remaining time. I lay in bed thinking about all the people I'm thankful to have in my life, and then proceeded to dream for what felt like an entire day, about going to a "waterpark" with my fiancée. It was sort of like the poolrooms, only outside, in the sun. Occasionally, I would get the typical worries I get while on vacation - is the dog being taken care of well, etc. But then I would remind myself it was just a dream. Literally the best dream I've ever had.
I've changed my tactic basically. Rather than becoming lucid and trying to teleport to where I want to be, I set positive intentions while awake and then go lucid in whatever place I end up. Guides in this general have helped a lot!
Last night I was exploring with some old classmates and current coworkers. One said something about the "other kids" getting candy. So I decided to find it, and voila, found the stairs leading up to the "candy room". I ate sour patch kids and M&Ms. The colors were so vivid and the sugar rush felt real. I think I'm in a childlike place mentally/spiritually.

posts.com:
Had a very short lucid dream last night. I'm a pretty regular lucid dreamer but it's still great to get them.
>reading sheet music in my loungeroom in preparation for a rehearsal
>the piece is real, "Ride" by Sam Hazo ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=au4geHy_S_0 ), but it doesn't look like how it should
>everything's properly legible but it doesn't fit with the piece as I know it
>look up
>a woman I don't really recognise is sitting at the table
>look at the far wall
>there's a bird cage on a pedestal and one of my pet cockatiels sitting on top of the cage
>waitaminute, my last cockatiel died years ago and I got rid of that cage when I decided no more birds
>I'M DREAMING
>there's a decent amount of resistance in the dream to me becoming lucid
>at first there's a small amount of doubt because of how real and normal everything feels, then things shift a little bit and I know that I was correct
>the light coming in the windows disappears like it suddenly became late evening outside
>the woman disappears
>get up and leave the house through the front door
>yep, it's pretty dark, feeling a bit uneasy
>a small insect buzzes my ear, looked like a fly
>grab it and it stays still
>90% sure something bad's going to happen despite my lucidity, which usually means something bad will happen
>reach the street and look down it
>there's a cluster of beautiful blue lights in the road a little bit further down the street
>as I get closer they start to form an emblem, which I was absolutely gobsmacked by its beauty
>took a good look at it so I could attempt to replicate it, but my skills aren't good enough in waking life to do it anywhere near the justice it deserves
>attempt to take a steam screenshot of it, even hear the click and even see the screenshot taken panel in my vision
>think to myself "There's no way that's going to persist after I wake up. A screenshot from a dream would be worldshattering"
>leave the dream an unusual way, feels like I'm being pulled upwards to my bed

>>33590995
for the ultra clear one? I became lucid in the dream, it was accidental
but I remember that I was sleeping disastrously all the previous days, only naps like that day(literally) and at that moment I think I had an alarm activated because I wanted to get up later to eat something... so i guess it was a bit of WBTB too

now i only have lucid dreams when i am a bit sleepy (not too much) i lie on my back and do breathing exercises focusing on it while i am listening to something on youtube at a very low volume
once I think I didn't even do breathing exercises and I only paid attention (a bit) to the audios I put on but I refused to sleep
other times I didn't pay attention to the audio (but still audio playing) but I did pay attention to what I saw in the dark
and other times the same but while I tried to move my "ghost" body (breathing exercises, you feel sleepy but then you start trying to move your body without moving a single muscle, as if you were preparing to move but you don't)... I think this was the most useful for me, now that I remember. I think I'm going to try again right now, I haven't done it in a long time.
the trick is to remain conscious but RELAXED to tell your brain or body that you are already sleeping while your consciousness is still active
Whatever you choose to do, it's extremely important that you do not move a single physical muscle or open your eyes, that's what all my successful attempts agree on

No technique all on its own will give you that. And no fap or working out won't either. posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>33614377

No. Oregano oil supplements are diluted with a carrier oil, such as olive oil. If you take it without diluting it, it will cause burns unless it's already diluted.

To make it safe to ingest you dilute the oregano essential oil with olive oil. Diluting it to 50% oregano oil will render it harmless for you but maintain it's effects as an anti-fungal. It also works as a "antibiotic", however based on repeated studies, we have found that it doesn't kill probiotics, only delays, and then slightly slows their rate of growth.

An example below shows that they have used it for culturing cheese due to the fact that it is able to significantly reduce E-Coli for example, but at the same time keep species like Lactobacillus acidophilus alive and while barely affecting their count.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31703879/

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:

For the skin, we can verify that it will improve it. Keep in mind that it could take months, even years to fully heal the skin, and this is because even if you kill the fungi that are causing the skin disorders, the damage to the skin takes a long time to "repair" itself and you will still have symptoms even after the fungi is killed. You will notice that when you do have said symptoms, they will not be nearly as bad nor will they seem to get worse on average.

Note: Fungal biofilms can be formed in the tissue, so don't be surprised if part of it starts flaking when you start the protocol. It's a normal die-off symptom that will pass.

Thank you. I appreciate those that are skeptical, they are usually much more careful and are less prone to making mistakes. We want people to move slowly on this protocol because while it has had positive results on average, it's still experimental.


Regarding some of your statements

>A million billion gorillion things contribute to cancer, asthma, diabetes and all of those other things that they listed that these fungi supposedly are the villain of.

Yes, you’re half-right. You're right because any things can contribute to cancer, asthma, diabetes, and obviously it isn't going to be due to fungi alone. The part that we probably have a disagreement is how much fungi can contribute to a massive range of chronic health conditions, cancer being one of the more worrisome. There are records of mycologists, doctors, and pathologists being suspicious because oral thrush had a high correlation with throat and oral cancer for example.

Oral thrush basically an overgrowth of yeast.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29310582/

Obviously, that isn't the only case, there is another where they examined other tumors as well.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/36179670/

I could go other cases but for time's sake we'll leave it at that for now.

Where I think you're wrong is that parasitic fungi are only "supposedly villains" and that this thread is a conjecture. Parasitic fungi are the villain of many chronic conditions. They can do damage to your skin, GI tract, brain function, endocrine system, and cardiovascular system for example, based on the recent and repeated studies from third-party organizations not even related to this thread.

Of course, don't take my word for it. Spend time to verify the claims. I recommend that you spend more time studying on this and not treat it as something interesting, but necessary. Based on events around the world, you may need to equip yourself with as much knowledge on parasitic fungi as possible.

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>33614323
Cont.

You seem to have concerns with Oregano oil and Black Seed oil, and that's reasonable. People have claimed that some herbal supplements put stress on the liver. I assume this is what you meant by "chipping away". However, both Oregano oil and Black Seed oil are exceptions to that trend and improve liver function.

>Black Seed oil
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23646296/

>Oregano
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33013016/

The protocol is designed so that these substances don't "chip away" at your health but improve it, and it's also the reason why the protocol itself follows the recommended dosage on the package of the supplements for long term because that is the amount that is safe to use if you have no underlying medical conditions. Mixing them doesn't make it more toxic and is still safe based on what the lethal dosage suggests for each. If you get severe die-off symptoms, then you should reduce the dosage of NAC and Oregano oil and take molybdenum. Start taking full doses again once recovered.

For context, die-off symptoms occur when the biofilm breaks down and exposes the pathogenic fungi. Doing that can cause an immune response, which is what causes the die off symptoms. The goal is to remove the fungi at a slow enough pace where the die-off symptoms are minor and you can, for example, still go to work without any major issues.

It's also to note that the protocol may not be safe for some people, and you should do your own research and talk to your doctor about using the supplements. Combining a bleeding disorder, high blood pressure, very low blood pressure, or diabetes with the protocol without consulting a doctor first for example would be unwise.

Feel free to post valid criticisms or concerns, any legitimate and backed up criticism is appreciated.

>this pathogen has developed multiple strategies to escape host immune defense. Here, we show that C. albicans secreted proteases interfere and inactivate host innate immune effector components, such as complement proteins. Secreted aspartic proteases (Saps) in the culture supernatant of C. albicans cells and also recombinant Sap1, Sap2 and Sap3 degrade host complement components C3b, C4b and C5 and also inhibit terminal complement complex (TCC) formation.

posts.com:
I saw Nexpo at a grocery store in Los Angeles yesterday. I told him how cool it was to meet him in person, but I didn’t want to be a douche and bother him and ask him for photos or anything. He said, “Oh, like you’re doing now?” I was taken aback, and all I could say was “Huh?” but he kept cutting me off and going “huh? huh? huh?” and closing his hand shut in front of my face. I walked away and continued with my shopping, and I heard him chuckle as I walked off. When I came to pay for my stuff up front I saw him trying to walk out the doors with like fifteen Milky Ways in his hands without paying.

The girl at the counter was very nice about it and professional, and was like “Sir, you need to pay for those first.” At first he kept pretending to be tired and not hear her, but eventually turned back around and brought them to the counter.

When she took one of the bars and started scanning it multiple times, he stopped her and told her to scan them each individually “to prevent any electrical infetterence,” and then turned around and winked at me. I don’t even think that’s a word. After she scanned each bar and put them in a bag and started to say the price, he kept interrupting her by yawning really loudly.

>>33624488
Basically the same as you would any other god/ess. Learn as much about them as you can. Then, think about what they stand for. What are their lessons? How do they behave? Do they say how you should behave? If not, then looking at what you know, how do you think they want you to behave? Now, apply that to your everyday life.

Be sure to give thanks for any blessings you receive. Making a small altar can help in this as it gives you a place to pray and leave offerings. Choose items They like and use that as inspiration.

>Examples of this stuff using Aphrodite
Do your own work. here. Don't just use my ideas. The personal nature of your effort is a form of worship, too, and will mean more than just doing stuff I suggest.

Aphrodite is a goddess of love, both erotic and not. One of her alternate names roughly means "She who loves smiles". Consider the nature of love and it's place in your life. Who do you love? Love yourself, others and the world as best as you can. Share a smile. Bring joy. Also learn from her mistakes. If you have/get someone who loves you, treat them right.

The altar should be made of Applewood or Myrtle if possible. A box turned upsideown works fine. Lovingly carve or paint her favorite things on it such as roses and doves. Adorn it with pearls and mirrors. Offer sweet treats like you would a lover. Candied roses, heart shaped chocolates, seashell chocolates, rose scented candles, ect.

I hope this is a good starting point!

Nice get.

>I feel everyone hates or grows tired of me
I felt that way, too. Then I realized a lot of it was in my head, internalized from going though hell when I was younger. The rest was the fact I was surrounded by shallow gits. Shallow people and deeper people naturally do not get along in the long term.

The first step was teaching myself that people don't hate me, especially if they hardly know me. They actually are indifferent most of the time. As to the ones who "know" you and "hate" you, stop and think about how much they get right about you. If it isn't that much, then they hate their preconceived notion of you. Hating you without really knowing you marks them as shallow fools not worth your time. Forget them. Let them go be shallow elsewhere. You don't need these people in your life.

>Thank you but how am I important
Part of being loved is also loving yourself and learning where you fit in with the world. Learning to love yourself can be hard when you have not been loved very much, but it's important. In the end you are the one person who can never leave you. Because of this, you need to accept yourself, see your value and importance as a person, and eventually love yourself. Ignore any nattering thoughts that you are not worthy or lovable: those are lies. You are worthy of love and good things. You can heal and feel better. I beleive in you!

It's also easy to ignore your physical self. If you don't care for yourself, then you can't get anything done long term. Take good care of yourself. Eat well, sleep well, drink your water and exercise. Don't smoke or engage in self-destructive behaviors. You will sober up and the problem will still be there.

It's a hard road. I know. I wish I could give you a hug and some company. You are seriously cute so hey- maybe a lot more than a hug. For now, though, all I can give is what I have learned over time. I hope it helps you find your way.

>>33613152
(1) The Earth's magnetic field is most likely generated by the interaction of flows of molten metal around the core of the planet. The flows of this metal in and out of the core, and around it (through convective processes), generates a magnetic field.

(2) The Coriolis effect and the combined magnetic and electrical generation of these processes keep the movement (very) roughly circular around the axis of rotation. If it was driven solely by convection and the Coriolis effect it would remain very stable for a long time, but the effect of powerful local magnetic fields and electric currents is able to disrupt this circular flow. If this flow is disrupted in one place, it is likely to disrupt in other places, leading to a complete destabilization of flow around the core-mantle boundary. Thus, the field collapses (no more circular flow). However, convection means the process starts up again, possibly in a different direction, possibly in the same direction.
(3) There's plenty of geological evidence to show that pole reversals can occur very quickly, and that on average they take 100-150 years to complete. The decay of our magnetic field began somewhere around 1900, and is accelerating.

As the field decays there will be several noticeable effects. First, it takes a weaker and weaker flare to produce a Carrington type event due to weaker shielding. Second, this weaker shielding results in more high energy particle bombardment in the upper atmosphere (the primary driver of short and long term changes in global climate [notably, most mass extinction events are associated with pole reversals]).

(4) How does electricity work? Not by the flow of electrons per se, but by the interaction of magnetic fields generated by the flow of electrons. The magnetic field of the sun interacts with planetary magnetic fields in the solar system to form an electric circuit. But in terms of this discussion, that interaction doesn't matter so much.

The sun is essentially a large nuclear fire. What happens what you throw a bunch of very cold, flammable dust on a fire? I've had bonfires at -40, and I'll tell you: first the fire dampens, then the fire gets much bigger than before and very quickly. The same would occur if you were to bombard the sun with a high amount of cosmic dust - the outer shell would cool, the sun would dim, and then the built up energy in the interior would catch up, the shell would warm up enough, and a "small" explosion would occur in which the outer shell of the sun is cast off.

There are two things to note here:
First, we have observed that the two nearest stellar neighbors to pass through the midplane ahead of us flared. They didn't flare bright enough to call it a super nova, but they flared too much to write it off as a random event or error. They flared in sequence, relative to the time they entered the galactic midplane.

Second: If the outer shell of the sun were to cool, the sun would dim. It may dim so much that the sun itself would turn dark red, possibly even black, dark enough that you could look directly at the sun. Instead of the normal luminescent star you would see a dark circle halo'd by the dust particles and field interaction lines created by the powerful electromagnetic interactions of the sun.

In short, the Black Sun is most likely an ancient symbol from the last time this happened.

Last post.

Back to how they can 'time' the event. In short, it's easy. The magnetic field is weakening:
1900-2000: 5% loss
2000-2010: another 5% loss
2010 to present: we don't know, field strength data is no longer published

Additionally, the poles are moving. >>33596975 demonstrates the movement of the magnetic poles. This tells us we are in a pole shift event, that it will happen, and the end date can be roughly predicted by the rate of field decay.

Additionally there is enough evidence to surmise it does happen every 12,000 years, coinciding with the frequency at which we pass through the galactic midplane. There is not much error in when this happens - we're doing it right now.

As for the crustal displacement theory: the crust is essentially held in place on the mantle by a combination of friction with the partially solid upper mantle and weak electric forces. Solar energy input through the solar-terrestrial magnetic electric circuit can heat up the upper mantle and disrupt these forces, causing the crust to locally displace (pretty much every earthquake over 6.0 is associated with space weather energy inputs). A large enough solar energy input (from a micronova, perhaps) theoretically can liquefy the entire upper mantle and cause the entire crust to detach. Then what happens? The crust still has its momentum, but the most weight is on the poles of its axis of rotation. Spin a weighted ball - the weight comes to the outside of the rotation, and thus Greenland and Antarctica move to the equator.

Santa denial is the ultimate result of a society that has reached its apex of rationalism and intellectualism, while concurrently burying its spiritual and ritualistic side of itself. We live in an Apollonian age of numbers, results, capital, etc. and it is killing the side of ourselves that believes in anything - this naturally leads to nihilism and bleakness. The same nihilism and bleakness that presides over the entirety of our culture today. This is why you don't see any great works of art anymore.

A Santa Denier is the man who deems himself intellectual for believing in the "science"; yet, has this man done his own research? He believes in molecules, yet has he seen them for himself under a microscope? I say, "NO". He was merely told this was the case from some book, or from some teacher. So, here, we see, this intellectual man is just as vulnerable to belief systems as anyone else.

William James backs me up in his essay, "The Will to Believe":
>"Yet if any one should thereupon assume that intellectual insight is what remains after wish and will and sentimental preference have taken wing, or that pure reason is what then settles our opinions, he would fly quite as directly in the teeth of the facts."

Santa IS real, because we believe him to be; it is as simple as that. When you see a present under the tree that says "From: Santa", that is all the proof you need.

I finish my essay with a question:
Walking through the mall are two people,
1.) A small child who just sat on Santa's lap and told him of their wishes, and is fully content after having participated in ritual and tradition. They fully believe that this Santa will fulfill all of their wishes.
2.) The smirking intellectual, who "knows" in his head that Santa is not real, and thinks that this child is naïve - yet he participates in the tradition, gift bags in hand, supporting the corporations and 1% he claims to hate.

Who is happier?

posts.com:
>/x/ and philosophy
Hi /x/, new here. Are any people here into philosophy besides the weird schizoconspiracy shit? I had some mystical insights reading philosophy myself.

At the start of philosophy was Plato, who believed in two realsm. There is the everyday realm, of bodies and objects which whither away, and then there is the timeless realm of the Ideas, which the trained philosopher can percieve with his mind's eye; one can compare this to a third eye of some sorts.

Deleuze believed philosophers created concepts out of the plane of immanence; a sort of undivided "field" of energies, forces, flows, without humans, without subjects, without consciousness. Life, death, and all dualities and dialectical relationships are non-existent on this plane.

Then Schopenhauer. He literally believed that the reality of individual objects in time and space; what he called "the world as representation"; is an illusion; all that exists is the fundamental unity of the Will. You are Will, I am Will, there are no humans, there aren't even beings. This is simply the veil of the Will covering your eyes.

Then Derrida, who believed that language is a completely empty system; that the idea of another person having written this message is an illusion stemming from a belief in "logocentrism".

Berkeley thought all of reality is subjective idas; the only thing binding it together is the universal observer: God.

So, anyone into philosophy? Want to share insights/mystical shit which you found in philosophy?

I think Plato was right about everything.

However that said, as one of the above posters mentioned. They Buddah may come to the final realization.

That is to say, from the Platonist position in the ontological hierarchy of true being, the highest point is The One/The Good or The One Itself and The Good Itself.
Everything below this participates in varying degrees of this, starting with the Intellect, Soul, Body. Proclus Elements of Theology gives a full outline and dialectic of coming to these concepts.

All this however is a result of conditioned existence, as explicated by the Buddah. Meaning its just a result of samsaric generation. The Buddah realized that the true Self, is none of these things, and can only be "known" by Neti Neti (Not This, Not That). So even if you magically somehow manage to take a form of a "God" its still part of conditioned existence and samsaric generation would not be the True Self, because that is beyond all conditioned existence.

So I think that this is truly the final bastion of Philosophy and its culmination.

>>33626469
There were Pre-Socratic philosophers such as Pythagoras and Parmenides. They and others like them were not as concerned with logical argumentation and have much esoteric interest in their writing.

Socrates, the mentor and teacher of Plato, invented a way to discern whether a statement is true using yes or no questions. Physicians use it today as a technique to diagnose patients.

Plato wrote plays called dialogues about Socrates having conversations with people about things such as "Is something true because god said so?"

This type of logical inquiry brought about a revolution in how people in the Mediterranean world sought knowledge and understanding.

The greatest philosopher of all time was Aristotle, the student of Plato. Aristotle wrote about logic, syntax, and semantics, categories of ideas, the natural world, biology, metaphysics, and ethics. His book Nichomachean Ethics is a foundational text in the establishment of an objective morality.

Later, philosophers like Galileo Galilei, Isaac Newton, and Albert Einstein revolutionized the way humans understand the universe. The philosophy of science is how scientific methodology is invented.

Today, philosophers do things like use psychiatry, neurology, and cognitive science in the search for the soul.

I guess philosophy isn't magic, but where do you draw the line?

It seems pretty magical.

Agrippa called some of his books "occult philosophy." He was a philosopher and a sorcerer.

>Does nothing actually exist
The key is in the word "thing". As in no-"thing".

I would say very few people who claim nothing exists are actually saying that reality is completely blank (notice that I used the word "blank" because any other word will imply some substance or other).

What they're really saying is that it's not material. It's about the concept of "objects" and "matter".

Even if there was actual "objects" in reality the only thing you could ever know about those objects is conscious experiences of them, and nothing more.
So why does there need to be an actual "object"? The idea is that only consciousness alone exists, and "objects" and "things" are just appearances within consciousness.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

Liminality:
>is the quality of ambiguity or disorientation that occurs in the middle stage of a rite of passage, when participants no longer hold their pre-ritual status but have not yet begun the transition to the status they will hold when the rite is complete.[2] During a rite's liminal stage, participants "stand at the threshold"[3] between their previous way of structuring their identity, time, or community, and a new way (which completing the rite establishes).

>More recently, usage of the term has broadened to describe political and cultural change as well as rites.[5][6] During liminal periods of all kinds, social hierarchies may be reversed or temporarily dissolved, continuity of tradition may become uncertain, and future outcomes once taken for granted may be thrown into doubt.[7] The dissolution of order during liminality creates a fluid, malleable situation that enables new institutions and customs to become established.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Most of the time these things have no effect on me, not sure why that is. It's like my brain can't get into that imaginative space anymore where I imagine myself in the 'world' of the image.

That said I think I might understand the feeling that's involved here. When I was like 6 my best friend left and I remember going home and standing in the backyard alone, it was sunny but quiet and cool and I remember standing there getting goosebumps and just feeling almost a form of pleasure in my body at the shift in perspective thinking that this 'time' with my friend was gone now and wouldn't be coming back.

There was also this time back in early 2011 when my family moved to another city but left me staying at the family home a while (it was rented) till I could get a place, it was summer and I suddenly had the house all to myself - two pets had recently died also so it was just me and one remaining pet. I was spending a lot of time on r9k in 2010 and then it was banned suddenly, so I was a NEET, alone with nobody in the world who knew me, and even that place of connection had suddenly disappeared, so I was totally alone, but I was happy and enjoying myself reading. The sunlight would stream in with a very sort of reddish hue in the afternoon and the stillness and peace was so beautiful and sacred, I often get almost like 'flashbacks' to my time there for a few months.

I returned to r9k and spent some more time there, and felt more connection and so on - then the culture changed and I found myself feeling alienated and alone and so I'd go back to the archives a fair bit and get this sense of the hauntedness of this 'space', even though it wasn't even a 'space' at all. It's weird the disconnect between visiting a 'live' site and visiting the archives - technically there should be no meaningful difference in experience apart from the interactivity of communication. Again I would get this beautiful, sad, nostalgic, haunted feeling.

I was with a friend in zanzibar and we got really drunk with some portugese girls one night. The next night we went on a reef exploration trip or something and we drove there with a small boat and a few locals. I was hungover and got seasick along the way.

The 'driver' of the boat at some point made us some chopped fruit and I remember starting to feel a bit better, talking to this portugese girl when all of a sudden I get this refluc feeling in my throat like I am close to vomiting. I say nothing, just jump off the boat in the shallow water and wade to the beach.

I walk along the beach for a minute or so, the sun was shining down brutally. I am on this uninhabited island with beautiful sea all around me and I spot an old little fishing vessel about 2 meters long on the beach. I walk up to it and sit on its old wooden hull, a leaning pose.

I remember looking around me, there was noone around, just me, the sky and the sea and this old wooden fishing boat. It was truly a surreal experience. Half a world away in a place I dont know I get this feeling that I am on the right track with my life and that this is exactly where I am meant to be in this specific moment and oddly enough, that I have been here before. It was magical, one of my fondest memories.

I liked your post anon so I decided to portray a kind of surreal experience that happened to me.

From what I know it is a space navigated by both conscious and unconscious mind. Night terrors can run the gamut from being caused by life problems to being etheric in nature. In the former your own introspection and psychological understanding is leading. In the latter, you will usually have a repeating element. The degree of lucidity and clarity and complexity of the sign indicates how well the beings consciousness and focus us directed. An advanced nincompoop can shoot an elaborately rendered scene in your head while a less capable being can at most spook you or rely on your own mental model to convey something.
As with germs, exposure can help, but too much is too much.
